author: @CountOrlok22
text: In regards to minors being used in labour, why is it so rarely mentioned that we have this idea of no taxation without representation in this country, yet we are bringing minors into the workforce who would be taxed and yet who cannot vote? This is something that needs to be explicitly addressed because it is a real concerted effort to take away not only the rights of workers and roll back the last century of child labour laws, but it's also an attempt to bring in workers who do not even have political freedoms who can vote against the repeal of such labour laws. It's a calculated move to create a legally unprotected sub-class of labour.

replies.author: @needleinasandbag1575
replies.text:
Holy shit, that's such a crisp analysis. Totally forgot the intended impact that children are literally powerless to vote against their own exploitation.

We can agree that minors are too young to consent, but apparently they aren't too young to work the friers and drive-thru. Even the guys we give guns are "technically" adults. Wtf.

author: @Gaza4Life2024
text:
The inflation thing is particularly egregious. People saw more than 20% inflation since 2020 and Pakmans excuse is the rate has fallen. Even if it has, prices are still more than 20% higher than they should be. IF wages didnt go up and prices didnt come down, then people are still at least 20% worse off, no matter what the rate is today. 
Add in interest rates and rents and people have lost at least 30-40% of their earnings in little more than 2 years(probably way more depending on rents)

replies.author: @_Jaybefaunt
replies.text: Exactly. People like me are catching hell no matter which side of the Duopoly is in office because they look out for their corporate owners.

author: @needleinasandbag1575
text:
Let's be real, I worked about exactly part-time due to disabilities.

I think I took home ~$1200/month. I was making near $15 which is supposedly the new magic minimum wage goal, but if I were able to work the full 40 hours, I would have made about $22/2300 a month.

Where the hell are these figures coming from? Even when the news is trying to level with the American people, they still use "middle class" hourly rates like $30+/hour. It's delusional and manipulative.

Outside of trades and office work, where are you seeing regular people make that kind of money? Their lowest bar is still double to triple what the guys stocking your shelves are making!

replies.author: @needleinasandbag1575
replies.text:
People forgot that Minimum wage originally meant the Minimum LIVABLE wage on which a single person could thrive working full time.

No one can survive working full time on $15/hour! Damn this system.

author: @Huy-G-Le
text:
This is why I told the channel to stops using Vietnam as an example of a good Socialist country, because this country have a ruling compromise half Corporatist, half Social Democracy government that still pretend to be Marxist Leninist, and a powerful economic (but not political) sectors of mostly dominating multi-billion-multi-nation-multi-share-owners that hires firms in Vietnam that basically hires these Mid Class Analysts whom interest are in line with the Business Class and the Share holder of big company and talks down the working class people.

To be honest, wages for physical laborer jobs are basically slash by 20% to 50% in Vietnam right now, under Vietnam Corporate employment, same apply to brain labors, but this happen slower, just like a few month ago, hundreds of IT worker was fires, because the company shut down during usual financial operation. Private works are the most common types on employment in VN. 

Idk what you was expecting, but this is not Iraq where 70% of jobs are public sectors, or Libya for 90% of jobs are public sectors, with a strong Socialist government. In Vietnam, the "Marxist" but pro-GDP-increase government allows Private corporation, include domestically own Vietnamese private corps, and big companies, Foreign private corps from specific country and multiple-national corps to do wherever they like too, as long as it is in legal boundary, like classifying full time and half time worker as "privateer" to not pay them benefits while working them above 8 hours limit, which if they do works after 8 hours, the company are legally oblige to pay them extra, except they don't do that too, by legally avoiding the laws. 

So call official and political personality from Vietnam don't talks about this, unless press enough, like Mr Pakman, whom will say the economy is doing great, and jobs are high. Yeah the Economy of Vietnam is doing great, for Multinational corporation shares owners from Paris and New York, working people got to works extra jobs because their basic wages, had been cuts.

replies.author: @CalebMaupintime
replies.text: This is spot on. Vietnam, China, and even north korea have a corporatist economic system. Corporatism can be found in its liberal form in social democracy and historical fascism. Actually existing socialism is just developmental nationalism , but self identified "marxist leninists" can't accept that.
